page.title: 12Cameley Mill ii
page.content: Between 1923 and 1968 the old mill buildings remained unchanged.In 1968 a tied bungalow was built.In 1979 the mill passed down to a third generation of Blackers (all called Frank). Initially dairy farming and calf breeding continued.In 1982-1983 the bungalow and 54 acres of land were sold to a neighbouring farmer and the mill was turned into Kennels.The main building is still a dwelling house and has been extensively renovated in recent years,although most of the main characteristics remain.In 1985 a Cattery is being added to the Kennels. The mill wheel was destroyed many years ago and the mill pond filled in in 1971 for safety reasons.Camely Mill or Mill Farm as it is now known consists of 37 acres used mainly for grazing beef and making hay. {See also Cameley Mill i}
